data.title: Symbolizing OSM rail lines in QGIS
data.meta_description: I am struggling to come up with a proper layer style for a rail network extracted from OSM in QGIS. I just want active rail so I choose the "rail" tagged features (rule-based rendering). But since ...
data.text:
I am struggling to come up with a proper layer style for a rail network extracted from OSM in QGIS. I just want active rail so I choose the "rail" tagged features (rule-based rendering). But since every track is a line and escpecially within cities, there a sometime 5 or more tracks close to each other so the symbology looks pretty ugly like in the screenshot. What could I do besides, deleting the features I do not want to be shown (which would mean a lot of work)?

I would stick to the OSM design as close as possible. It works pretty well accross most zoom levels.

I use #787878 for the base colour. Width 1mm. For the dashed line on top I use white as colour. Width 0.6mm. Cap style Square. Custom Dash 1.5mm (Space 3).

answered Apr 8, 2016 at 11:10

Dennis BauszusDennis Bauszus
